title: QUANTOS team wins EIT Jumpstarter 2025
excerpt: The QUANTOS team highlights its participation in the EIT Jumpstarter 2025, where its spin-off initiative, ProSpec, was awarded 1st Prize in the Raw Materials category at the EIT Innovation Awards.
author: Tomás Lopes

title: QUANTOS at the 9th Spanish and Portuguese Advanced Optical Microscopy Meeting (SPAOM)
excerpt: From November 5th to 7th 2025, the QUANTOS team took part in the 9th Spanish and Portuguese Advanced Optical Microscopy Meeting (SPAOM), which took place in Braga, Portugal.
author: Carolina Gonçalves

title: QUANTOS Visits CEITEC to Advance Lithium and Rare-Earth Mineral Studies
excerpt: On August 25th, 2025, researchers from INESC TEC and QUANTOS Diana Guimarães, Rafael Cavaco, Diana Capela, and Pedro Jorge , visited CEITEC’s LIBSLab in Brno, Czech Republic, within the framework of the EXCITE Transnational Access Project.
author: Diana Guimarães

title: New paper published in Optics Letters
excerpt: Our team has published a new paper in Optics Letters: High-precision acoustic event monitoring in single-mode fibers using Fisher information
author: Tiago Ferreira

title: A prototype quantum camera capable of making the invisible visible is being developed at QUANTOS Research Team
excerpt: A team of researchers at INESC TEC, is developing a prototype of a quantum camera capable of seeing the invisible.
author: The Team

title: QUANTOS at AMACEE
excerpt: From August 26th to 28th, 2025, the QUANTOS team participated in the 5th International Symposium on Advanced Measurement, Analysis, and Control for Energy and Environment (AMACEE), held in Brno, Czech Republic.
author: Rafael Cavaco

title: QUANTOS at Colloquium Spectroscopicum Internationale
excerpt: At CSI XLIV in Ulm, Germany (July 27–31, 2025), Diana Guimarães was an invited speaker and presented the work entitled “Spectral Imaging Applications for Industrial Settings,” showcasing how LIBS, Raman, and hyperspectral imaging support real-time industrial decision-making.
author: Diana Guimarães

title: QUANTOS PhD student Diana Capela wins ESP Young Minds poster award
excerpt: Diana Capela, a PhD researcher at INESC TEC, was awarded the PhD Best Poster Award at the ESP Young Minds U. Porto Poster Contest 2025 for her work titled: Fiber Laser LIBS as a Sensing Tool for Chemical Mapping of Heritage Tiles.
author: Catarina Monteiro

title: QUANTOS at CLEO®/Europe-EQEC
excerpt: The Quantos team presented three works at the CLEO®/Europe-EQEC, held June 23 - 27, at ICM – International Congress Center of Messe München, Germany.
author: Catarina Monteiro

title: QUANTOS team elements meets and inspires the next generation!
excerpt: Today’s classrooms, tomorrow’s scientists: INESC TEC meets and inspires the next generation.
author: The Team

title: New paper published in Applied Sciences
excerpt: New paper published in Applied Sciences: Beyond Human Vision: Unlocking the Potential of Augmented Reality for Spectral Imaging
author: Nuno Silva

title: Participation of the QUANTOS Team at OFS-29
excerpt: From May 25 to 30 in Porto, the QUANTOS team presented three cutting-edge studies on fiber-optic sensing at OFS-29. The work showcased advancements in LIBS for cultural heritage, high-frequency speckle interrogation, and Fisher-optimized polarimetric sensing.
author: Catarina Monteiro

title: And the laboratory goes QUANTUM
excerpt: The quantum imaging and sensing team made the first experimental observations of the quantum nature of light. With a GRA experiment, the probed the light anti-bunching, a hallmark of the quantum nature of light.
author: Tiago D. Ferreira

title: New paper published in Physical Review Letter: Digital Feedback Loop in Paraxial Fluids of Light: A Gate to New Phenomena in Analog Physical Simulations
excerpt: The imaging team has recently published a paper in the renowned scientific journal Physical Review Letter that explores the next generation of analogue simulations with paraxial fluids of light.
author: Tiago D. Ferreira
